1: <sup>1</sup> O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: because his mercy endureth for ever.
2: <sup>2</sup> Let Israel now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.
3: <sup>3</sup> Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.
4: <sup>4</sup> Let them now that fear the LORD say, that his mercy endureth for ever.
5: <sup>5</sup> I called upon the LORD in distress: the LORD answered me, and set me in a large place.
6: <sup>6</sup> The LORD is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?
7: <sup>7</sup> The LORD taketh my part with them that help me: therefore shall I see my desire upon them that hate me.
8: <sup>8</sup> It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in man.
9: <sup>9</sup> It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in princes.
10: <sup>10</sup> All nations compassed me about: but in the name of the LORD will I destroy them.
11: <sup>11</sup> They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about: but in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.
12: <sup>12</sup> They compassed me about like bees: they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.
13: <sup>13</sup> Thou hast thrust sore at me that I might fall: but the LORD helped me.
14: <sup>14</sup> The LORD is my strength and song, and is become my salvation.
15: <sup>15</sup> The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tabernacles of the righteous: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.
16: <sup>16</sup> The right hand of the LORD is exalted: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.
17: <sup>17</sup> I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the LORD.
18: <sup>18</sup> The LORD hath chastened me sore: but he hath not given me over unto death.
19: <sup>19</sup> Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will go into them, and I will praise the LORD:
20: <sup>20</sup> This gate of the LORD, into which the righteous shall enter.
21: <sup>21</sup> I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.
22: <sup>22</sup> The stone which the builders refused is become the head stone of the corner.
23: <sup>23</sup> This is the LORD’s doing; it is marvellous in our eyes.
24: <sup>24</sup> This is the day which the LORD hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
25: <sup>25</sup> Save now, I beseech thee, O LORD: O LORD, I beseech thee, send now prosperity.
26: <sup>26</sup> Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the LORD: we have blessed you out of the house of the LORD.
27: <sup>27</sup> God is the LORD, which hath shewed us light: bind the sacrifice with cords, even unto the horns of the altar.
28: <sup>28</sup> Thou art my God, and I will praise thee: thou art my God, I will exalt thee.
29: <sup>29</sup> O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
